page.title: 13Landscaping:Uckfield Bypass.
page.content: Every effort has been made for the 7.3m single carriageway to fit into the landscape with as little disrup- tion to the{countryside}as possible. Trees will be planted to integrate the road with the land and match existing woodland. The Ridgewood housing area will be partly{screened}in this way. Wooded areas on either side of the A26 will be extended so that the junc- tion and its traffic will have a back- ground of trees to reduce the effect of moving traffic. Ridgewood Farm which has its land split by the Bypass has a cattle creep or tunnel. This is not big enough for large farm machinery so they will have to go further than before. {Laybys}are planned for each section to allow people to stop and enjoy the scenery. Wild flower seeds have even been used on the slopes by the road.
